abstract: The court is being asked whether corporations and political groups can be sued in the United States on accusations of human rights abuses abroad.
snippet: The court is being asked whether corporations and political groups can be sued in the United States on accusations of human rights abuses abroad.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court agreed on Monday to hear a pair of cases on whether corporations and political groups may be sued in American courts for complicity in human rights abuses abroad.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Hear 2 Human Rights Cases
headline.print_headline: Two Human Rights Cases On Supreme Court Docket

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
